basics.name: Haidar Khan
basics.label: ResearchScientist
basics.summary: A researcher trying to understand how machines can learn and how that can help humans solve challenging problems.

work.name: National Center for AI, Saudi Data and AI Authority
work.summary: Building a national foundation model (ALLaM) for the Kingdom of Saudi Arabia serving the government and private sectors with capabilities in Arabic and English.
highlights: Created a training stack capable of training models at 49% MFU based on MegatronLM.
Pretrained and aligned our models on trillions of tokens of English and Arabic data.
ALLaM outperformed all open and closed models on automated and human evaluations in Arabic

work.name: Amazon Alexa
work.summary: Large scale training of large (1B - 100B parameter) language models on web-scale datasets as part of the Alexa Teacher Model (AlexaTM) program.
highlights: Developed infrastructure to scale training of large language models using DeepSpeed.
Compressed large language models for natural language understanding, automatic speech recognition rescoring, and semantic parsing.
Combined AlexaTM with visual understanding and image generation models to create new multimodal Alexa experiences.

work.name: Amazon Alexa
work.summary: Natural language understanding (NLU) research for virtual assistants including language modeling, semantic parsing, and intent/entity recognition.
highlights: Deployed efficient transformer-based models for Alexa NLU that satisfy production latency constraints (<10ms inference).
Lead a team of 4 scientists and engineers to speed up sequence-to-sequence semantic parsing systems by 3x with parallel decoding.

work.name: Siemens Corporate Technology
work.summary: Modeling agents and adversaries in a power plant network with reinforcement learning.
highlights: Increased the possible number of modeled agents by a factor of 2 with available hardware.

work.name: IBM T.J. Watson Research Center
work.summary: Empirically studied the minibatch size/convergence rate tradeoff for deep neural network training.
highlights: Designed a variant of parallel SGD and analyzed performance on benchmark datasets and networks
The algorithm implemented on an IBM HPC cluster reduced total training time from 14 to 4 days.
